action.action-desc: Mr. Onder (for himself and Mr. Messmer) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and Workforce

form.official-title: To amend the National Labor Relations Act to require secret ballots and employee participation in the election of representatives.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Worker Enfranchisement Act.

subsection.text: Section 9 of the National Labor Relations Act (29 U.S.C. 159) is amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: in subsection (a), by inserting That no person shall be an exclusive representative of employees in such unit unless such person has been designated or selected as the exclusive representative of such employees by a majority of the voters in a secret ballot election in which not less than two-thirds of such employees vote; Provided further, after employment: Provided, ; and
in subsection (c)(3), by inserting of the at least two-thirds of employees eligible to vote after majority.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this Act shall apply in relation to elections occurring on or after the date that is 6 months after the date of enactment of this Act.
